Princeton ACM

The official website for the Princeton University student chapter of the Association for Computing Machinery.

Jane Street Info Session

Please join Jane Street for an informative look into the world of trading and technology. We will discuss both full time and summer internship opportunities.
Jane Street is a proprietary trading firm that operates around the clock and around the globe. We bring a deep understanding of markets, a scientific approach, and innovative technology to bear on the problem of trading profitably in the world’s highly competitive financial markets.
Founded in 2000, Jane Street employs over 340 people in New York, London and Hong Kong. Our entrepreneurial culture is driven by our talented team of traders and developers / researchers.  We are always recruiting top students and invite you to learn more about an internship or career at Jane Street.
Location: East Pyne 010
Time: 7-8pm
Date:Thursday, September 12th 
We invite all students (undergraduate, masters, doctoral) looking to utilize their quantitative and technical skills in a trading environment to attend.  Food and beverage will be served.
Please visit janestreet.com for additional information.

September 12, 2013

Zero Venture Partners

Dear ACM Group,

 

My name is Abeer Desai. I graduated from NYU Stern two years ago and have recently founded a company called Zero Venture Partners. One of the things we do is help startups articulate their value proposition on the internet, and establish thought leadership through activities such as blogging.

 

I want to connect passionate students with an opportunity to make $50/blog post writing about new developments and trends in their field of study. These blog posts will be written on behalf of a startup that is innovating in this same field.

 

This is a great chance for students to develop written and communication skills, add additional experience to their resume, and earn a solid side stream of money. Our program requires 1 blog post per week with each post being 600 - 900 words.

 

We currently have 1 open opportunity for a student studying in a field (or with appropriate experience) related to cloud technology and mobile app development.

 

If you are interested in learning more I would be happy to provide additional information.

 

Let me know if you would like to keep in touch about future companies we work with.

 

Best regards,

Abeer Desai

Founder, Zero Venture Partners

September 11, 2013

Pearson Contest

Dear ACM Member,

I'm reaching out to all of the student ACM chapters to let everyone know that Pearson is sponsoring a Student Coding Contest this fall and we encourage you to participate!

The contest runs from September 3 - November 30 and is open to all undergraduate students in the United States. Students can work solo, or in teams of up to 5 members.

We're giving away great prizes too!

1st Prize: $10,000 and an invitation to present at SXSWedu

2nd Prize: $5,000

3rd Prize: $1,000

For contest details and to sign up, visit www.pearsonstudents.com/codingcontest.

Feel free to contact me directly with any questions at yez.alayan@pearson.com.

Best,

Yez Alayan

September 11, 2013

Hello, I am your new computer

A poem by Willa

Hello, I am your new computer,
The thinnest, lightest, fastest one alive.
I've never seen a superuser cuter
Than you, the apple of my drive.

If only I could take you on a date,
We'd have a lovely dinner set for 10.
But I cannot escape this solid state:
Forever single, always craving you.

In my imagination, we'd hold hands
While walking down a beach of Unix shells.
I'd serve you Google maps to distant lands--
And give you Wi-fi free at the hotels.

We'd cuddle, streaming chick flicks legally,
We'd write each other secret notes in hex.
If being human meant you'd be with me,
I'd, in a Flash, exchange these specs for sex.

September 07, 2013

Kickoff with a C@N

Welcome back to school. Classes haven't even begun, and already a Code@Night is just around the corner.

Code@Night Zero: the first Code@Night of the 2013-2014 school year
Who's invited? You are!
Where is it? Sherrerd Hall. Third Floor. Sept 13. 9pm.
When? Sept 13. 9pm. (In Sherrerd, on the third floor) It'll still be going at 3am. Come when you can, leave when you must.
Join the Facebook event!

At 10pm there will be a tech talk from a Bridgewater engineer titled "GIT for Data: How we're tackling big data problems in Research."

GIT for Data: How we're tackling big data problems in Research. (A tech talk with Ken Vogel)

In Bridgewater's Research department, we build models of the world that need to be frequently resimulated, analyzed and understood. Our problem differs and overlaps with traditional big data in some interesting ways. Come learn about our architecture, an immutable database lets us keep less data. Our stack includes investment logic written in Scala and Excel and stored in GIT, a distributed data engine based on Cassandra (used by Netflix), and a distributed calc engine (eventually moving to the cloud).

Thanks Bridgewater for sponsoring the first Code@Night of the year!
